intro: Spergularia segetalis proles pyrenaea, commonly known as the common sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along paths. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand drought.
